articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Aircraft dropped water and fire retardant on steep hills to stem the eastward spread of the Palisades Fire. The LA county supervisor called it "another night of unimaginable terror and heartbreak."
articles.title: San Fernando Valley under threat as Los Angeles fire rages on

articles.author: Nidhi Verma, Chen Aizhu, Siyi Liu, Florence Tan
articles.description: Chinese and Indian refiners will source more oil from the Middle East, Africa and the Americas, boosting prices and freight costs.
articles.title: Tougher U.S. sanctions to curb Russian oil supply to China and India

articles.author: Pesha Magid
articles.description: Foreign ministers and top diplomats from Western and Middle Eastern countries are meeting Syria's new foreign minister in the Saudi capital Riyadh on Sunday at the first such regional meeting on Syria since President Bashar al-Assad was ousted last month.
articles.title: Syria talks being held in Riyadh with Western and regional participation

articles.author: Chad Terhune, Fred Greaves
articles.description: Flames were licking his fence, he was choking on smoke, and bullets were whizzing by his leg. Despite it all, Tristin Perez never left his Altadena home during the deadly Eaton fire.
articles.title: California wildfires devastate Altadena: How one man tried to save his block

articles.author: Maayan Lubell
articles.description: A top level Israeli security delegation arrived in Qatar on Sunday for talks on a Gaza hostage and ceasefire deal, a spokesperson for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said, in a possible sign of so-far elusive agreements nearing.
articles.title: Top Israeli security delegation in Doha for Gaza talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskiy called on allies on Sunday to honour all promises to supply Ukraine with weapons, including those to counter Russian air attacks.
articles.title: Zelenskiy calls on allies to honour promises on arms supplies to Ukraine

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: The president is getting daily updates on ceasefire talks in Doha, Jake Sullivan told CNN.
articles.title: Biden likely to talk with Netanyahu; hostage deal 'very close,' security adviser says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Italian justice minister has filed a request to revoke the arrest of an Iranian businessman detained in Milan who was wanted by the United States on suspicion of involvement in a drone strike against its forces, the justice ministry said on Sunday.
articles.title: Italian minister requests revoking of arrest of detained Iranian businessman

articles.author: Charlotte Greenfield
articles.description: Nobel Peace Prize winner Malala Yousafzai urged Muslim leaders on Sunday to back efforts to make gender apartheid a crime under international law, and called on them to speak out against Afghanistan's Taliban over its treatment of women and girls.
articles.title: Malala Yousafzai urges Muslim leaders to back gender apartheid legal push

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japanese Foreign Minister Takeshi Iwaya said on Sunday he planned to attend Donald Trump's inauguration as U.S. president on Jan. 20, as Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba's government hopes to maintain close ties with its security ally.
articles.title: Japan's foreign minister says he will attend Trump inauguration
